msItem.title: Dhakira-yi Guvirnir Jinral Hishtin Sahib. Vol. III [The Treasure of Governor General Hastings Sahib (Warren Hastings). ] / commissioned by Warren Hastings.
msItem.note: Not in Morley's catalogues. This is different from the work known as the Hidaya in Persian based on the Arabic Hidaya of Marghinani, also undertaken for Warren Hastings and published in translation by Charles Hamilton (London 1791), and in Persian (Calcutta 1807). For MS of this see Ethe, No. 2613; Rieu, i, pp. 23-4. General Gordon's bequest of books and Turkish, Perian and Arabic manuscripts is mentioned, without details in the donations register under November 6 1841. The bequest is mentioned in J.R.A.S., vii, 1843, Annual Report, p. x, and the manuscripts are briefly listed in the Proceedings, pp. xxx-xxxi. Ruled and coloured margins to text. Headings in red.

bindingDesc.p: Persian. Scribe may possibly be the author. One volume.F1a recto: AE. 12784. [Đ]1 4s 0. Tm. In blue pencil: Add MSS No. 18.Last folio verso: No 55. D.2.5.Dark brown oriental binding. Paper labels on spine: a) No. 10 Translation of Farsi Huddayah No 10. b) Persian 6.For other MSS of parts of this work see Ethe, India Office Catalogue, Nos. 2614-5.This is different from the work known as the Hidaya in Persian based on the Arabic Hidaya of Marghinani, also undertaken for Warren Hastings and published in translation by Charles Hamilton (London 1791), and in Persian (Calcutta 1807). For MS of this see Ethe, No. 2613; Rieu, B.M. Catalogue, i, pp. 23-4. References: c.f. Ethe, India Office Catalogue.
